page.title: 03DISTRICT COUNCIL CHAMBER
page.content: The District Council offices are in Elmodesham House, a Georgian building in Amersham High St,which was once a Non-Conformist boarding school called Ebenezer West Academy.It is a lovely building-but the council need more room and are building new offices in Amersham-on-the-hill. Chiltern is one of the five district Councils in Bucks: All 50 councillors meet in the council chamber every 6 weeks.They are all elected and not paid a salary, but can claim expenses. Mrs. Stone (from Planning) had already told us about the work of the council, and she introduced us to the chairman, councillor Cresswell. He wore his chain of office with the crest and the motto"Freely we serve." Everything they discuss in a council meeting is recorded in a "minute book" and signed by the chairman.
